claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.

evidence.quote: Intratumoral mRNA vaccination triggers local innate sensing and type I interferon signaling.
| Type I interferon response score (normalized units) | 3.1 | 1.0 | Marked induction after mRNA vaccination in tumors |

claims.caveat: Some mechanistic readouts were strongest in specific model systems rather than uniformly across all tested settings.

claims.claim: Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase, leading to a broader peptide repertoire on MHC-I.

evidence.quote: 2. Interferon-associated antigen processing and presentation pathways increase.
3. A broader peptide repertoire appears on MHC-I, improving tumor visibility to T cells.

claims.caveat: Mouse model effects may not map one-to-one to all human tumors.

claims.claim: Intratumoral mRNA vaccine and anti-PD-L1 combinations improve tumor control in mice.

evidence.quote: Combined intervention improves tumor control in mice
| Intratumoral CD8+ T-cell density fold-change | 1.8x | 1.0x | Increased immune infiltration with combination therapy |

claims.caveat: Vaccine-only treatment did not produce durable tumor control in non-immunogenic models.

claims.claim: Prior SARS-CoV-2 mRNA vaccination is associated with better outcomes in human metastatic patients receiving ICI treatment.

evidence.quote: | Retrospective human survival comparison p-value | p=0.01 | N/A | Vaccinated subgroup had improved survival under ICI treatment |
aligns with better outcomes in the retrospective human cohort.

claims.caveat: The human analysis is retrospective and non-randomized; residual confounding is likely.
